            def process_accounting_information
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
              routes_data = MultiJson.load(params['bag'])
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
              routes_data.map do |raw_article_info, visits|
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                route_pattern, route_accounting_info = MultiJson.load raw_article_info
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                Route.find_by(pattern: route_pattern).try(:accounting, route_accounting_info, visits.to_i)

    52. 
          
          
              end
        
      53. 
      
        
    53.

      56.

          1
          
            def invoke
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
              ret = catch(:halt_processing_context) { yield }
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
              return head ret   if ret.is_a?(Fixnum)
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
              return head(*ret) if ret.is_a?(Array)
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
              ret
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
            end
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
          
        
      63.

          1
          
            def context_headers(from = nil)
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
              h = from || request.headers
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
              # Forces User encoding to UTF8 because it can have strange characters
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
              # and session marshalling dumping/loading dont resolve it
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
              h['HTTP_X_YAVU_USER'] = h['HTTP_X_YAVU_USER'].try :force_encoding, 'UTF-8'
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
              selected_headers = Hash[h.select {|k,_| k.match(/^HTTP_X_YAVU/) }.map {|k,v| [k.gsub(/^HTTP_X_YAVU_/,'').gsub('_','-'),v] }]
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
              logger.debug "API request headers filtered to: #{selected_headers}"
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
              Rack::Utils::HeaderHash.new(selected_headers)
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
            end
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
          
        
      73.

            def ensure_client_application
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
              @client_application = ClientApplication.enabled.find_by_identifier params[:id]

            def ensure_service_context

              @component_configuration = ComponentConfiguration.find(params[:component_configuration_id])

    86. 
          
          
              @route = @client_application.routes.detect { |x| x.services.include? @service } if @service

            def prepare_etag(context)
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
              (context.etag + context_headers.values.compact).tap do |etag|
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                etag << @client_application
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                logger.debug "Etag made from: #{ActiveSupport::Cache.expand_cache_key etag}"
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
              end
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
            end
        
      114.

      116. 
      
        
    116.

      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
            # know it was an actual 404 instead of receiving an erroneous 500.
        
      118.

            # Search for articles using params hash, which may contain:
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
            #   * query [String] string to be searched
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
            #   * id [Integer] element to exclude from the result set obtenined with query search
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
            #   * ids [Array] array that contains ids of articles to search.
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
            #       If this parameter is set are ignored both "id" and "query".
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          1
          
            def search
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          5
          
              ids = (params[:ids] || []).reject &:blank?

    88. 
          5

          5

      90.

          4

            def set_paths_from_session
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          42
          
              @list_path         = session['client_application_asset.list_path'] || client_application_assets_path(@client_application)

          42
          
              @edit_path         = session['client_application_asset.edit_path'] ||
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                @asset && @asset.persisted? && edit_client_application_asset_path(@client_application, @asset) ||
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                client_application_assets_path(@client_application)
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          42
          
              @edit_content_path = session['client_application_asset.edit_content_path'] ||
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                @asset && @asset.persisted? && edit_content_client_application_asset_path(@client_application, @asset) ||
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                client_application_assets_path(@client_application)
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          42
          
              @show_path         = session['client_application_asset.show_path'] ||
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                @asset && @asset.persisted? && client_application_asset_path(@client_application, @asset) ||
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                client_application_assets_path(@client_application)
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          42
          
              @rename_path       = session['client_application_asset.rename_path'] ||
        
      140. 
      
        
    140.

      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                client_application_assets_path(@client_application)
        
      142. 
      
        
    142.

            def self.call(env)

    3.

      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                preview: view_context.preview_medium(@medium, prefix: 'modal', controller: 'articles'),
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                caption: @article.try(:title),
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                medium_id: @medium.id
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
              }
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
              render json: result
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
            end
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
          
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          1
          
            def autocomplete
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
              ids = (autocomplete_params[:ids] || []).reject &:blank?
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
              matches = if ids.empty?
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                          Medium.search(query: autocomplete_params[:q]).limit(search_limit)
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                        else
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                          meth = autocomplete_params[:order].present?? :find_ordered : :find
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                          Medium.public_send(meth, autocomplete_params[:ids])
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                        end
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
              render json: matches.map { |medium| Hash[id: medium.id, text: render_to_string(partial: "media/#{medium.type.underscore}/select2_options", locals: { medium: medium } )] }
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
            end
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
          
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          1
          
            private
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
              # Before-action callback to guard the validity of the media type provided
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
              # by the user. Any invalid type will trigger a redirection to the index
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
              # page with an exaplanatory flash message
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          1
          
              def guard_type
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          14
          
                valid_types = Medium.types.collect &:to_s
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          14
          
                type = params[:medium][:type]
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          14
          
                unless valid_types.include? type
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          1
          
                  respond_to do |format|
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          2
          
                    format.html { redirect_to media_path, alert: I18n.t('media.new.messages.missing_type') }
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          1
          
                    format.json { render json: { errors: I18n.t('media.new.messages.missing_type') }, status: 422 }
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                  end
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                end
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
              end
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
          
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
              # Façade method to provide a unique entry-point for any of the *_params
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
              # methods that are type-specific.
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          1
          
              def medium_params
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          34
          
                type = params[:medium][:type]

          34

          34

      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
              end
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
          
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          1

      140.

            def batch_action
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
              case Integer(params[:batch_action])
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
              when DELETE_FROM_REPRESENTATION_BATCH then
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          2
          
                @representation.assets.delete(ClientApplicationAsset.find(params[:assets]))
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          2
          
                msg = I18n.t('representation_assets.batch_action.delete.message')
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
              when ADD_TO_REPRESENTATION_BATCH then
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          2
          
                @representation.assets.concat(ClientApplicationAsset.where(id: params[:assets]).where.not(id: @representation.assets.pluck(:id)))
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          2
          
                msg = I18n.t('representation_assets.batch_action.add.message')
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          5
          
              end if params[:assets]
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          5
          
              redirect_to @list_path, notice: msg
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
            end
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
          
        
      80.

            def set_paths_to_representation_assets_controller

            def search

          5

          4

          module ActionsHelper
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
            # Render lists of actions buttons on both sides of context-actions container.
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
            # => scope is use to get translations.
        
      4.

            # => left_actions contain a hash with actions to display on left side.

            # => right_actions contain a hash with actions to display on right side.
        
      6.

            # => options contains rendering options, html tags, html options, etc.

            def render_context_actions(scope, left: {}, right: {}, options: {}, target: nil)

              options[:buttons] = true

            def render_dropdown_actions(target, scope, actions = {}, options = {})

            def filter_actions(actions, target = nil)
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          693
          
              actions.select do |action|
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          1318
          
                action.delete(:condition) && (target ? can?(action.delete(:action), target) : true)
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
              end
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
            end
        
      48.

      49.

            # Return de specific action translation for scope if exist, else return shared translation.
        
      50.

          1
          
            def t_action(action, scope)
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          1275
          
              t action, scope: [:activerecord, :actions, scope], default: t(action, scope: [:activerecord, :actions, :shared])

            end

            # Set to each elements for actions hash the correct options to render.

            def create_links(scope, actions, options)
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          693
          
              actions.map do |action, action_options|
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          1318
          
                build_options(scope, action, action_options, options)
        
      58. 
      
        
    58.

      59.

      60.

            def build_options(scope, action, action_options, options)
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
              # Action defaults
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          1318
          
              case action
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                when :new, :edit
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          249
          
                  action_options.reverse_merge! class: 'success'
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                when :associate, :enable
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          25
          
                  action_options.reverse_merge! class: 'success', divider: true
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                when :disassociate, :disable
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          25
          
                  action_options.reverse_merge! class: 'alert', divider: true
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                when :back
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          207
          
                  action_options.reverse_merge! class: 'secondary'
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                when :destroy
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          153
          
                  action_options.reverse_merge! divider: true, class: 'alert', method: :delete, data: {}
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          153
          
                  action_options[:data][:confirm] ||= t(:destroy_confirmation, scope: [:activerecord, :actions, scope], default: t('activerecord.actions.shared.confirmation.destroy'))
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
              end
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
              # Group action title
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          1318
          
              action_options[:actions_title_class] = 'actions-group-title' if action_options[:title]
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
              # Permission-related action name
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          1318
          
              action_options[:action] ||= action
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
              # Text button
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          1318
          
              action_options[:text] ||= t_action(action, scope)
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
              # Group action title
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          1318
          
              action_options[:actions_title_class] = 'actions-group-title' if action_options[:title]
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
              # Divider
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          1318
          
              action_options[:divider_class] = 'divider' if action_options[:divider]
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
              # Condition
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          1318
          
              action_options[:condition] = true unless action_options.has_key? :condition
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
              # Add common css classes
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          1318
          
              action_options[:class] = "action button radius #{action_options[:class]}" if options[:buttons]
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          1318
          
              action_options
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
            end
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
          end

            def channel_path(resource, namespace: nil)

    25. 
          604

          291
          
                  '/announcement/all'

      29.

    30.

      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          10
          
                  "/article/#{resource.to_param}"
        
      32.

          9

          3
          
                  "/announcement/#{resource}"
        
      36.

      37. 
      
        
    37.

              uri = namespace + uri unless namespace.blank?
        
      38. 
      
        
    38.

      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
            end

    app/helpers/backend_plugin_helper.rb

      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          1
          
          module BackendPluginHelper
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
            # Escape the provided configuration so that it is suitable for its use
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
            # in an HTML snippet.
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
            # Usage:
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
            #   <section id="container" data-plugins="<%= escape_configuration initializer: {} %>">Content</section>
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
            #   <!--
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            #     Will render to:
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            #       <section id="container" data-plugins="{&quot;initializer&quot;:{}}">Content</section>
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
            #     -->
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          1
          
            def escape_configuration(configuration)
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          1377
          
              h MultiJson.encode(configuration)
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
            end
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
            # Un-escape the provided (escaped) configuration so that it is a valid hash object again. This is the
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
            # opposite operation of #escape_configuration.
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
            # Usage:
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
            #   original_hash = unescape_configuration '{&quot;initializer&quot;:{}}'
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
            #     # => { initializer: {} }
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          1
          
            def unescape_configuration(configuration)

          1
          
              configuration = Sanitize.clean(configuration)

          1
          
              MultiJson.load(configuration).to_options

            # Add the data-plugins attribute to an HTML element.
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
            # Usage:
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
            #   <section id="container" <%= plugins initializer: {} %>>Content</section>
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
            #   <!--
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
            #     Will render to:
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
            #       <section id="container" data-plugins="{&quot;initializer&quot;:{}}">Content</section>
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
            #     -->
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          1
          
            def plugins(configuration)

          817

                def prefilter(timerange, section, has_main_image)
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          8
          
                  closure = where(d: timerange)

    55. 
          8

      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          8

                def list_popular(timerange, section = nil, with_image = nil, limit = 10)
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
                  articles = all.in(i: parse_interval(timerange)).map { |most_commented| Article.find_by slug: most_commented.a }
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
                  articles.delete_if do |article|
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                    section_pred = section ? ->(a) { a.section != section } : ->(_) { false }
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                    !article || (!article.visible? || section_pred.(article))
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                  end.uniq.first(limit).map &:slug
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                end
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
          
        
      32. 
      
        
    32.

      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          1
          
                def persist(hash, interval)
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                  # we first delete all the previos persisted objects
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          1
          
                  where(i: interval).delete
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
          
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          1
          
                  hash.each do |elem|
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          2

      39.

      40.

                def parse_interval(interval, strict = false)
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                  n_days = interval.count
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                  interval = case n_days
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                  when (1..2)
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                    %w( 1d )
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                  when (7..8)
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                    %w( 1d 7d )
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                  when (28..31)
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                    %w( 1d 7d 30d )
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                  end
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                  strict ? [interval.last] : interval
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                end
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
              end
        
      57. 
      
        
    57.

                def perform_visit(article, visits, is_base: false)
        
      50.

                  find_or_create_by(article: key_field_for(article), is_base: is_base).tap do |art|

          202

      52. 
      
        
    52.

      53. 
      
        
    53.

                # Returns true if the voting was succesful or false if the user has already voted

          1
          
                    when "like"    then up(article, user); true

                # Retrieves all votes for an article with the following structure:
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                #
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                # { up: <positive_votes>, down: <negative_votes> }
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                #
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                # Uses mongodb aggregation framework. See http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/applications/aggregation/
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          1
          
                def votes(article, only_real_votes: false)
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                  # Filter by article
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          2
          
                  filtering_by_article = { "$match" => { "a" => key_field_for(article) } }
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                  # For each vote generate a new temp document with this structure
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          2
          
                  count_real_votes = only_real_votes ? 0 : "$v"
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          2
          
                  counting_votes_by_type = {
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                    "$project" => {
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                      "up"   => { "$cond" => [{ "$eq" => ["$u", SYS_BASE_LIKE]},    count_real_votes, { "$cond" => [{ "$eq" => ["$v",  1]}, 1, 0]  }]},
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                      "down" => { "$cond" => [{ "$eq" => ["$u", SYS_BASE_DISLIKE]}, count_real_votes, { "$cond" => [{ "$eq" => ["$v", -1]}, 1, 0]  }]}
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                    }
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                  }
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
          
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                  # Group by article_id and sum each column
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                  # (in fact, there will always be only one group because of the previous match operation )
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          2
          
                  grouping_vote_types = {
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                    "$group" => {
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                      "_id"  => "$a",
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                      "up"   => { "$sum" => "$up" },
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                      "down" => { "$sum" => "$down" }
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                    }
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                  }
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                  # Remove the _id field of the result document
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          2
          
                  removing_id_field = { "$project" => { "_id" => 0, "up" => 1, "down" => 1 } }
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
          
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                  # Finally, feed the mongodb aggregate pipeling with each step built previosly:
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          2
          
                  res = collection.aggregate(
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                    filtering_by_article,
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                    counting_votes_by_type,
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                    grouping_vote_types,
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                    removing_id_field).first # because #aggregate always returns an array
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
          
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                  # And return the resulting hash
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          2
          
                  res ? res.symbolize_keys : { up: 0, down: 0 }
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                end
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
          
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          1
          
                def perform_vote(article, user, new_value)
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          12
          
                  find_or_create_by(user: user, article: key_field_for(article)).tap do |v|
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          12
          
                    v.update_attributes(default_attributes_for(article).merge(value: new_value, user: user))
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          12
          
                    article.touch
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                  end
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                end
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
              end
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
            end
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
          end

            # both-ways check on the association of the articles, i.e. any articles
        
      111.

            # related to this one either as the originator or the target of the relation
        
      112.

            # will be included by this method.
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          1
          
            def related
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
              self.class
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                .but(self)
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                .joins('join article_relations on (id = article_a_id OR id = article_b_id)')
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                .where('article_a_id = :id OR article_b_id = :id', id: id)
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          5
          
                .uniq
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
            end
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
          
        
      121.

            # Return a comma-delimited string with the IDs of the related articles
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
            # associated to this article
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          1
          
            def serialized_related
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          10
          
              articles.collect(&:id).join(',')
        
      125. 
      
        
    125.

      126.

      127.

            # Update the set of articles related to this one to match the ones
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
            # specified in +related+.
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          1
          
            def serialized_related=(related)
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          3
          
              scope = Article.but(self)
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          3
          
              related = related.is_a?(Array) ? related.first : related
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          3
          
              self.articles = related.split(',').collect do |id|
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          10
          
                scope.find_by(id: id)
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
              end.uniq.reject(&:blank?)
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
            end
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
          
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          1
          
            def copy(attributes = {})
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
              # Copy attributes
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          11
          
              dup(except: [:slug, :time], include: [:tags, :articles, :article_media]).tap do |copy|

    140. 
          11
          
                copy.time = Time.current

          11
          
                copy.update_attributes(attributes) unless attributes.empty?
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
              end
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
            end
        
      144.

      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          1
          
            def date
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          110
          
              edition.try(:date) || created_at.try(:to_date) || Date.today
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
            end

            # Elasticsearch support methods
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
            #
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
          
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
            # Abstraction method that provides a simple interface for performing a
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
            # full search based on the values of +query_string+, +date+, +section_name+ & +sort_by+.
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          1
          
            def self.perform_search(query_string = nil, date = nil, section_name = nil, sort_by = 'date_desc')
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
              queries = []
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
          
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
              sort = case sort_by
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                when 'date_asc'
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                  { 'edition.date' => { order: 'asc' } }
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                when 'date_desc'
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                  { 'edition.date' => { order: 'desc' } }
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                when 'rank'
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                  '_score'
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
                else
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
                  { 'edition.date' => { order: 'desc' } }
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
              end
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
          
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
              if query_string.present?
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
                queries << Hash[
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
                  multi_match: {
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
                    query: query_string,
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
                    type: 'most_fields',
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
                    fields: [ 'title^3', 'lead^2', 'body', 'heading', 'tags.name' ]
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
                  }
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
                ]
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
              end
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
          
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
              date_object = date.to_date rescue nil
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
              if date_object.present?
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
                queries << Hash[
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
                  multi_match: {
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
                    query: date_object,
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
                    fields: [ 'edition.date' ]
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
                  }
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
                ]
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
              end
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
          
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
              if section_name.present?
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
                queries << Hash[match: {'section.name' => section_name}]
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
              end
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
          
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
              query = { query: { bool: { must: queries } }, highlight: { fields: { title: {}, body: {}, lead: {}, heading: {} } }, sort: sort }
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
              es_search(query)
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
            end
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
          
        
      302.

            def as_indexed_json(options = {})

      308.

      309. 
      
        
    309.

      312.

      314.

            protected
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
              # Automatically tags an article based on its content using an autotagger
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
              # object (available via @autotagger)
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          1
          
              def autotag
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          567
          
                if self.body
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          567
          
                  autotags = @autotagger.tags_from self.body
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          567
          
                  self.transaction do
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          569
          
                    autotags.map! { |t| Tag.where(name: t).first_or_create }

          567

      327.

      328.

              # Before-create callback that generates a slug for this article if

      330. 
      
        
    330.

      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          1
          
              def set_slug
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          567

    333. 
          567

          # Crea un medio para el articulo
        
      6.

      7.

          # La clase ArticleMedium crea un medio para el articulo con:
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          # * article_id
        
      9.

          # * medium_id
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          #
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          # == Ejemplo
        
      12.

          #
        
      13.

          # ArticleMedium = ArticleMedium.create(article_id: 6, medium_id: 9)
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          #
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          # === Clase ArticleMedium
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          #
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          1
          
          class ArticleMedium < ActiveRecord::Base
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          1
          
            belongs_to :article, touch: true
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          1

          9

      16.

    1. 
          
          
          # Asset
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          #
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          # Provides the includer class the ability to respond as an assets builded upon a carrierwave uploader
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          #
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          # The behavior is implemented by defining methods for interacting with carrierwave
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          # uploader, check uniqueness and DRY code needed by every class that manages assets like:
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          #   - Component
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          #   - ClientApplication
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          #
        
      10.

          #
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          # This module adds the following features:
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          #
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          #   #editable? whether asset can be edited with a text editor
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          #   #content returns asset content
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          #   #update_content! sets content to asset

              if compiled

            def update_content!(content)

          5

    48. 
          8

      51.

          # Returns asset relative path from uploader store_dir

            def relative_url(include_namespace = true)
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          79

    60. 
          77

              url.split('/').last

      67.

      68.

            # Returns relative asset path inside asset_type directory.
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
            # For example, the returned value for a component asset named javascripts/image_galery/main.js
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
            # will be image_gallery/main.js
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
            # If a client applications asset named javascripts/somejs.js
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
            # will be somejs.js
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
            # This method is used by sprockets
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          1
          
            def relative_url_without_extension(include_namespace = true)
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          41
          
              path = relative_url(include_namespace).split '/'
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          41
          
              file = File.basename path.pop, '.*'
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          41
          
              if path.count > 0
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          11
          
                File.join(path,file)
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
              else
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          30
          
                file
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
              end
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
            end
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
          
        
      84. 
      
        
    84.

      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          5

      86. 
      
        
    86.

              File.rename(self.file.file.file, "#{absolute_url}/#{new_file}")
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          5

      88. 
      
        
    88.

      89. 
      
        
    89.

          module Representations::DraftManagement

            extend ActiveSupport::Concern
        
      3.

            # Return whether this representation has a draft
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          1
          
            def has_draft?
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          942
          
              draft.present?
        
      7.

            end
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          
        
      9.

            # Create a draft for this representation (copying its related elements)
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            # @see BaseRepresentation#copy
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          1
          
            def generate_draft
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          13
          
              return draft if has_draft?
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          12
          
              draft_name = I18n.t 'activerecord.attributes.draft.draft_name', representation: name
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          12
          
              transaction do
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          12
          
                copy_and_save_as(RepresentationDraft, draft_name)

      18.

      19.

            # Destroy the draft associated to this representation - if any.
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          1
          
            def discard_draft
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          4
          
              if has_draft?
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          2
          
                draft.destroy.tap do
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          2
          
                  trigger_draft_creation
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                end
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
              end
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
            end
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
          
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
            # Destructively apply this representation's draft, replacing this representation
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
            # with the draft. If no draft is available, this method won't do a thing.
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
            # This representation object will be turned into a RepresentationBackup so that
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
            # any changes can be undone.
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
            # @see Representation#replace_with
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          1
          
            def apply_draft!
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          1
          
              transaction do
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          1
          
                self.replace_with draft, become: 'RepresentationBackup'
        
      36. 
      
        
    36.

            def views_from_config(hash)

            def views_by_format(force_html = true)

            # Return the templates for this representation, which are:
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
            #   * This representation's layout
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
            #   * This representation's error view

            #   * The views of all the component configurations associated to this representation
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          1
          
            def templates
        
      32.

          4
          
              Hash[
        
      33.

      34.

      35.

          8

    43.

            # Return a comma-delimited string with the names of the tags associated to
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            # this model.
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          1
          
            def serialized_tags
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          37
          
              tags.pluck(:name).join(',')
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
            end
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
            # Set the associated tags for this model to be the ones in the provided
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
            # comma-delimited string, creating any one of them which doesn't exist.
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
            # If any of the tags is a combined one (isn't a root tag), its root will be
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
            # used instead.
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          1
          
            def serialized_tags=(tags)
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          8
          
              self.tags = tags.split(',').collect do |name|
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          27
          
                tag = Tag.find_or_create_by(name: name)
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
                # If the tag has a combiner, use that instead
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          27
          
                tag = tag.combiner unless tag.combiner.nil?
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          27
          
                tag
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
              end.uniq
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
            end
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
          end

                def __calculated_values(context)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          32
          
                  instance_variables.each do |name|
        
      116.

          212

            # Process a component configured context. In order to do that:
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
            #  * Create a new unnamed class initialized with
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
            #     - component_configuration available_attributes as instance_variables
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
            #     - This new object respond_to #evaluate that it is implemented by component#context field
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
            #     - When an error occurs, it will be traped, mark component_context as erroneous and log error
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
            # * Call new_object#evaluate(component_context, component_configuration)
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
            # * Expect to set component_context values properly or mark it as erroneous
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          1
          
            def process_component_context(component_context, parent_context, component_configuration)
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          36
          
              klass = process_component_klass component_context, parent_context, component_configuration
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          35
          
              klass.class_exec do
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          35
          
                def evaluate(context, component_configuration)
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                  # If Component#context raises an exception it will print a pretty message with line error in the context of Component#context code
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          35
          
                  instance_eval(component_configuration.component.context.to_s, "Component#context[#{component_configuration.component.name}]", 1)
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          32
          
                  __calculated_values(context)
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                end
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
              end
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          35
          
              object = klass.new(parent_context, component_configuration,user)
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          35
          
              object.evaluate(component_context, component_configuration)
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
            rescue Exception => e
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          4
          
              component_context.errors << e.message
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          4
          
              logger.error "#{self::class}##{__method__}: Error populating component: #{component_configuration.component.name}:#{component_configuration.id} => #{component_context.errors.join("\n")}"
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          4
          
              logger.error e.backtrace.join "\n"
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
            end
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
          
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          1
          
            def process_parameters(request_parameters = {}, headers = {})
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          41
          
              request_parameters.select! {|k,_| root.available_parameters.include? k.to_s }
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          40
          
              params = Hash[request_parameters.each {|k,v| [ ContextProcessor.sanitize_instance_variable_name(k), v ]}]
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          20
          
              params.merge(headers: headers).with_indifferent_access
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
            end
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
          
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
          end

            def process_component_service_context(component_context, parent_context)

      37.

            def self.search(params = {})

            def date_with_format(format = :long)

            def become_active!

            def method_missing(meth, *args, &block)
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
              # First of all, we must give delegate the call to AR because
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
              # a great part of AR working relies on this method. After completed
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
              # this step, now we can hook up into it and do whatever we want.
        
      11.

          225
          
              super
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
            rescue NoMethodError => e

    13. 
          224
          
              method = meth.to_s.gsub(/=$/,'')
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          224
          
              attribute = ExtraAttribute.find_by name: method
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          224
          
              if attribute.try(:is_for?, my_model_class)

    16. 
          203
          
                case args.count
        
      17.

                when 0 then

    18. 
          147

                when 1 then

    app/models/filters/base_filter.rb

    100.0 % covered

    68 relevant lines. 68 lines covered and 0 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          
          
          # Base class for any object used for keeping filtering logic + criteria together.
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          #
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          # This class provides the following functionality out-of-the-box:
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          #
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          #   - Automatic values sanitizing: The values passed to the #initialize method
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          #     will be fed into #sanitize and the result of that process will be used for
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          #     setting the filter values.
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          #   - Hash-like accessors: Any value for the filters can be get/set via []/[]=,
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          #     just like Hashes.
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          #
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          # For examples, please:
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          # @see ArticlesFilter
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          # @see SupplementFilter
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          1
          
          class BaseFilter
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
            
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
            # Default values. This method should be overridden
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
            # when in need to specify particular defaults for a
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
            # subclass.
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          1
          
            def self.defaults
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          107
          
              {}
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
            end
        
      22.

            def render_value(key, value, scope)
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          4
          
              custom_value_method = "value_for_#{key}"
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          4
          
              value = case
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                when self.respond_to?(custom_value_method)
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          2
          
                  send(custom_value_method, value)
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                when is_foreign_key?(key.to_s)
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          1

      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          1
          
                  value_of_foreign_key(key, value)
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                else
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          1
          
                  value_of_default(value)
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                end
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          4
          
              value = I18n.t(key, scope: [ scope, :filter]) + ": " + value.to_s
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
            end
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
          
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          1
          
            def is_foreign_key?(key)
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          2
          
              key =~ /_id\z/ && key.gsub(/_id\z/, '').classify.safe_constantize.present?
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
            end
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
          
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          1
          
            def value_of_foreign_key(key, value)
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          1
          
              key.to_s.gsub(/_id\z/, '').classify.safe_constantize.find(value)
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
            end
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
          
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          1
          
            def value_of_default(value)
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          1
          
              value.to_s
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
            end
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
          
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          1
          
            def value_of_boolean(value)
        
      196.

          1
          
               I18n.t('filter.labels.boolean.' + value)
        
      197. 
      
        
    197.

    app/models/filters/base_model_filter.rb

    100.0 % covered

    22 relevant lines. 22 lines covered and 0 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          
          
          # Base class for ActiveRecord-bound filter classes.
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          # Subclasses must implement the #model method and optionally add
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          # custom filtering methods, as explained below in the #apply_to method.
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          1
          
          class BaseModelFilter < BaseFilter
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
            # Get the model class to which the filters will be applied.
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
            # This method must be overridden in subclasses.
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          1
          
            def model
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          1
          
              raise NotImplementedError
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            end
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
            # Get all the matching records to the current filter criteria.
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          1
          
            def all
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          91
          
              matches = model.send(scope)
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          91
          
              matches = apply_to matches
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
            end
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
            # Get the scope that will start the filter criteria as a symbol.
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
            # The default scope is :all.
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          1
          
            def scope
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          91
          
              :all
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
            end
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
          
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
            # Applies the filter criteria specified for the different fields to :matches,
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
            # an ActiveRecordRelation which should start by matching all the "filterable"
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
            # records.
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
            #
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
            # Each field will be processed in the following way:
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
            # 1. Check if self responds to a custom filter method of the form: "filter_by_<FIELD_NAME>". If it does,
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
            #    delegate the filtering of records by that field to the method. Such a method must return the updated
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
            #    ActiveRecordRelation.
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
            #    For instance, if the field name is "slug", its custom filter method will be named "filter_by_slug":
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
            #
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
            #     def filter_by_slug(partial, value)
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
            #       partial.where(slug: value)
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
            #     end
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
            #
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
            # 2. If no custom filter method is available for the field, check for a default filter method by the class
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
            #    of the value. Supported classes out-of-the-box are:
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
            #
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
            #    - String:    Will search with a 'like "%value%"'.
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
            #
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
            # 3. Otherwise, leave the logic up to ActiveRecord. Will add a where constraint like follows:
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
            #
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
            #     partial.where(field.to_sym => value)
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
            #
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          1
          
            def apply_to(matches)
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          111
          
              values.inject(matches) do |partial, pair|
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          314
          
                field, value = pair
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          314
          
                unless value.blank?
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          104
          
                  type = value.class.name.downcase
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          104
          
                  custom_filter_method = "filter_by_#{field}"
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          104
          
                  default_filter_method = "filter_#{type}_field"
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          104
          
                  if self.respond_to? custom_filter_method
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                    # Custom filtering
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          46
          
                    partial = self.send custom_filter_method, partial, value
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                  elsif self.respond_to? default_filter_method
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                    # Default method filtering
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          49
          
                    partial = self.send default_filter_method, partial, field, value
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                  else
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                    # Leave it up to AR and its magic
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          9
          
                    partial = partial.where(field.to_sym => value)
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                  end
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
          
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          314
          
                partial
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
              end
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
            end
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
          
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
            # Filters String fields using LIKE.
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          1
          
            def filter_string_field(partial, field, value)
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          49
          
              partial.where("#{field} like ?", "%#{value}%")
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
            end
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          end
        
      74.

    app/models/filters/client_applications_filter.rb

            def self.defaults

      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          1
          
            def simple_filter_key
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          2
          
              :query
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
            end
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
            
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
            # Custom filter method for :name and :url
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          1
          
            def filter_by_query(partial, value)
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          3
          
              partial.where('name like :value OR url like :value', value: "%#{value}%")
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
            end
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
            # Custom filter method for :enabled field.
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          1
          
            def filter_by_enabled(partial, value)
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          11
          
              case value
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          3
          
                when 'enabled'  then partial.where enabled: true
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          2
          
                when 'disabled' then partial.where enabled: false
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          6
          
                else partial
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
              end
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
            end

      28.

            # Custom filter method for searching by value on articles or medias.
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          1
          
            def filter_by_query(partial, value)
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          10
          
              value = "%#{value}%"
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
              # May brings performance issues
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          10
          
              articles_ids =  Article.search(query: value).map(&:id)
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          10
          
              media_ids = ArticleMedium.where(article_id: articles_ids).pluck(:medium_id).uniq
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          10
          
              partial.where('name like :value OR media.id IN(:ids)', value: value, ids: media_ids)
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
            end
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
          
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          1

      40.
